intro: Pasania densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered pasania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forest understories. Its foliage is evergreen, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and arranged oppositely on the stems.
